distribution.text: Copyright Â© Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
Red Hat AMQ Interconnect 1.9.0 release packages are available for A-MQ Interconnect on RHEL 6, 7, and 8.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat AMQ Interconnect is a component of the AMQ 7 product family. AMQ Interconnect provides flexible routing of messages between AMQP-enabled endpoints, whether they are clients, servers, brokers, or any other entity that can send or receive standard AMQP messages.

This release of Red Hat AMQ Interconnect 1.9.0 serves as a replacement for Red Hat AMQ Interconnect 1.8.0 and includes security and bug fixes, and enhancements.  For further information, refer to the release notes linked to in the References section.

Security Fix(es):

* jQuery: allows XSS via the load method (CVE-2020-7656)

* jquery: Cross-site scripting due to improper injQuery.htmlPrefilter method (CVE-2020-11022)

* jQuery: passing HTML containing <option> elements to manipulation methods could result in untrusted code execution (CVE-2020-11023)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgements, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: A flaw was found in jquery in versions prior to 1.9.0. A cross-site scripting attack is possible as the load method fails to recognize and remove "<script>" HTML tags that contain a whitespace character which results in the enclosed script logic to be executed. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jquery: Cross-site scripting (XSS) via <script> HTML tags containing whitespaces
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat Enterprise Linux version 6, 7 and 8 ship a vulnerable version of JQuery in the `pcs` component. However the vulnerable has not been found to be exploitable in reasonable scenarios. A future update may update JQuery to a fixed version.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata relevant to your system have been applied.

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: jquery: Cross-site scripting (XSS) via <script> HTML tags containing whitespaces

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: A Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability exists in JQuery. This flaw allows an attacker with the ability to supply input to the âHTMLâ function to inject Javascript into the page where that input is rendered, and have it delivered by the browser.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jquery: Cross-site scripting due to improper injQuery.htmlPrefilter method
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: No supported release of Red Hat OpenStack Platform is affected by this vulnerability as no shipped packages contain the vulnerable code.
notes.title: Statement

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: A flaw was found in jQuery. HTML containing \<option\> elements from untrusted sources are passed, even after sanitizing, to one of jQuery's DOM manipulation methods, which may execute untrusted code. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jquery: Untrusted code execution via <option> tag in HTML passed to DOM manipulation methods
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
Red Hat Enterprise Linux versions 6, 7, and 8 ship a vulnerable version of JQuery in the `pcs` component. However, the vulnerability has not been found to be exploitable in reasonable scenarios. 

In RHEL7, pcs-0.9.169-3.el7_9.3 [RHSA-2022:7343] contains an updated version of jquery (3.6.0), which does not contain the vulnerable code.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata relevant to your system have been applied.

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: jquery: Untrusted code execution via <option> tag in HTML passed to DOM manipulation methods
